docs.snippet: Spending billions of dollars for TV rights and becoming partners with universities desperate for exposure, ESPN has emerged as a sport’s puppet-master and kingmaker....
docs.lead_paragraph: Spending billions of dollars for TV rights and becoming partners with universities desperate for exposure, ESPN has emerged as a sport’s puppet-master and kingmaker.
docs.abstract: ESPN has become chief impresario of college football by infusing sport with billions of dollars it pays for television rights; money and programming directed toward college gridiron by ESPN and its competitors have transformed the game, creating professionalized sports empires in the midst of academic institutions (Series: Remote Control).

headline.main: College Football’s Most Dominant Player? It’s ESPN
headline.sub: Spending Billions, Network Rules the Schedule

byline.original: By JAMES ANDREW MILLER, STEVE EDER and RICHARD SANDOMIR

docs.snippet: Coach like Alabama’s Nick Saban argue that spread offenses, because of their fast pace and more frequent number of plays and the way they limit defensive substitutions, lead to more injuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: Coach like Alabama’s Nick Saban argue that spread offenses, because of their fast pace and more frequent number of plays and the way they limit defensive substitutions, lead to more injuries.
docs.abstract: Many college football coaches argue that spread offenses, because of their fast pace and more frequent number of plays and the way they limit defensive substitutions, lead to more injuries; spread proponents find argument without merit.

headline.main: Coaches Talk of Injuries, Trying to Slow the Spread
headline.print_headline: Coaches Talk Of Injuries, Trying to Slow The Spread

docs.abstract: Profile of South Carolina defensive end Jadeveon Clowney, known for his exploits from an early age; Clowney is expected to be chosen first over all in 2014 NFL draft.

docs.snippet: Johnny Manziel’s style, rooted in improvisation and individualism, is challenging a tradition of institutional dominance valued by Nick Saban and Alabama....
docs.lead_paragraph: Johnny Manziel’s style, rooted in improvisation and individualism, is challenging a tradition of institutional dominance valued by Nick Saban and Alabama.
docs.abstract: Style of Texas A&M quarterback and 2012 Heisman Trophy winner Johnny Manziel, rooted in improvisation and individualism, is challenging college football tradition of institutional dominance valued by reigning-champion Alabama and its coach Nick Saban.

headline.main: Thriving on Chaos, Manziel Shocks a Traditional System
